docs.snippet: Israel has expedited construction permits to enable temporary quarters for the U.S. Embassy to open in Jerusalem as planned in May, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Israel Fast-Tracks Wall, Escape Route for New U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem
headline.main: Israel Fast-Tracks Wall, Escape Route for New U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem

docs.snippet: North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un pledged his commitment to denuclearisation and to meet U.S. officials, China said on Wednesday after his meeting with President Xi Jinping, who promised China would uphold friendship with its isolated neighbour.

headline.print_headline: China Says North Korea's Kim Pledged Commitment to Denuclearisation
headline.main: China Says North Korea's Kim Pledged Commitment to Denuclearisation

headline.print_headline: White House Investigating Loans to Kushner's Business: Official

docs.snippet: Since the end of World War II, the victorious powers have promoted trade, democracy and collective security. Now, that order is under assault.

headline.print_headline: Postwar Global Order Is Attacked From Within
headline.main: The Post-World War II Order Is Under Assault From the Powers That Built It

docs.snippet: The United States said on Monday it would expel 60 Russian diplomats, joining governments across Europe in punishing the Kremlin for a nerve agent attack on a former Russian spy in Britain that they have blamed on Moscow.

headline.print_headline: U.S., EU to Expel More Than 100 Russian Diplomats Over UK Nerve Attack
headline.main: U.S., EU to Expel More Than 100 Russian Diplomats Over UK Nerve Attack
